g.text: the pSoup helper plasmid were thawed on ice, mixed with 50-100 ng of DNA at the bottom
of a pre-chilled 2 mm gap electroporation cuvette (VWR, Radnor, PA, USA), and kept on ice
for 15 min. Electroporation was carried out using an
(Bio-Rad, Hercules, CA, USA) according to the manufacturer's instructions at 2.50 kV,
pulse length, and 400 Ω default resistance. 1 mL of liquid SOC medium pre
28°C was then immediately added to each cuvette, and the cells transferred to 15 mL Falcon
tubes for recovery over 2-3 h at 28°C under shaking (ca. 120 rpm). 250
ame visible on the agar plates
after approximately 2 days of incubation at 28°C.
Cam-strain plants were grown on B5 medium supplemented with 1.6 g/L
sporangia (2 per nuclear transformation to be attempted) were crushed with
a polypropylene cell spreader until only small fragments (< 5 mm in diameter) remained
O (1 mL per nuclear transformation) was added, and the tube vortexed
vigorously for 30 sec. The crushing and vortexing steps were repeated, the suspension passed
cell strainer (Corning, Wiesbaden, Germany) to remove plant debris,
